page.title: 12Recreation
page.content: Stenhousemuir's{football}club is called "The Warriors". They started playing as a club in 1884 and have continued since then and are now 5th in the 2nd Division. The team play in maroon and white strips and have a good name as friendly players. UNfortunately the team is poorly supported, but the supporters have a good reputation and rarely cause trouble. The chairman would like to see a new stand and new toilets, to improve facilities for the supporters. One of the ball boys thinks that a bigger shop selling more "sweeties" etc. would bring in more money. The football ground was built on Tryst ground. The{cricket}club started there(1876) and there is also a{golf} club(1885), one of 3 in the area. There are 3 bowling and 1 tennis club.
